TITLE.P: EU-China Tourism Year Digital Marketing Campaign

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Contracting Authority intends to commission the production of a digital marketing campaign. The campaign is targeted towards Chinese consumers, who have an interest in travelling abroad, with focus on cultural explorers and authentic experience seekers that resident in first and second tier cities in China.
The objective of the digital marketing campaign is to raise consumer awareness of Europe as a travel destination in China on the occasion of the celebration of the 2018 EU-China Tourism Year.

The Contracting Authority intends to commission the production of a digital marketing campaign. The campaign is targeted towards Chinese consumers, who have an interest in travelling abroad, with focus on cultural explorers and authentic experience seekers that resident in first and second tier cities in China.
The objective of the digital marketing campaign is to raise consumer awareness of Europe as a travel destination in China on the occasion of the celebration of the 2018 EU-China Tourism Year.

The digital marketing campaign comprises three inter-connected parts, which are meant to inspire potential travellers to Europe and convert their aspiration into actual bookings. Each part of the campaign is described below. These parts form one and indivisible project. The procurement is not subdivided into lots.
1. Advertising campaign on Chinese Online Travel Agencies (OTA)

Production and advertisement of a dedicated Destination Europe online pavilion (flagship store) on the websites of at least 2 leading Chinese online travel agencies as well as on their respective mobile applications. On these pavilions, users will be able to access comprehensive destination information, travel advice and book unique European travel experiences.

Production, online distribution and advertisement of digital travel guides on at least one leading Chinese travel portal. These guides will offer comprehensive destination information, suggested itineraries, travel advice and practical information in a smart and visually appealing manner.

Design, development, implementation and promotion of a WeChat mini program. The mini program is defined as a semi-independent application included in the main WeChat app which provides various functionalities aimed at curating and promoting relevant information for Chinese travellers to Europe.

INFO_ADD.P: The Contracting Authority intends to use competitive procedure with negotiation, reducing the term for the invitation to participate to 15 days and tender to 10 days. This is related to the state of urgency in which the project should be implemented.
The Contracting Authority reserves the right to award the tender on the basis of the initial tender.

ACCELERATED_PROC.P: The project is funded by the European Commission as part of its initiative 2018 EU-China Tourism Year. The initiative starts with the calendar year, on 1.1.2018.

The services subject of this tender are related to the promotion of Europe as a tourism destination in China through a targeted marketing campaign. The success of a marketing campaign of this kind depends on its timing. In order to influence potential travellers’ decision on their next holiday destination, the campaign should be active in the moment when such decision is made, which is usually around a month before the so called “booking window”. For the Chinese market the booking window is in April-May (travelling happens mostly around a big national holiday in the beginning of October). Therefore, the marketing campaign should start in February or March 2018. Considering the time needed to prepare such campaign, the contract should be signed by February 2018 the latest.
